gov.nasa.worldwind.examples.shapebuilder
Class RigidShapeBuilder

java.lang.Object
  gov.nasa.worldwind.examples.ApplicationTemplate
      gov.nasa.worldwind.examples.shapebuilder.RigidShapeBuilder

public class RigidShapeBuilder
extends ApplicationTemplate

RigidShapeBuilder is a tool for creating and editing 3D shapes and placing them on the globe. Possible shapes include the rigid shapes (Ellipsoid, Box, Cylinder, Cone, Pyramid, Wedge) as well as ExtrudedPolygon. The RigidShapeBuilder user interface allows the user to select the desired shape from a dropdown menu, create an instance of it with the click of a button, and specify an "edit mode" for modifying the shape: move, scale, rotate or skew. Numerous shapes may be created and placed on the globe together, but only one may be selected and edited at any given time.

Keyboard shortcuts allow the user to toggle easily between the various edit modes. The shortcuts are as follows:

Ctrl-Z: move Ctrl-X: scale Ctrl-C: rotate Ctrl-V: skew
